item.title: alsa-utils' arecord bug: lots of *.wav files, ignoring --duration parameter
item.description: I ran into a rather funny bug recently – when recording audio on an RPi with Raspbian Jessie via an external USB sound card, arecord doesn’t stop recording after a period of time specified by --duration flag, but keeps running and filling files *-01.wav, *-02.wav, etc. with garbage data. Googling doesn’t return a solution, except an obvious one to killall -KILL arecord. USB microphones are also affected. Since I have another RPi running Wheezy and showing no symptoms of the bug (and being free of systemd malware ;), the bug is likely in arecord itself.
